transportAdvice: Paris has an extensive metro and bus network that covers virtually all tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. The city center is highly walkable, and taxis are widely available, though public transit is generally the fastest and most practical option.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent overcast skies; pack warm layers and a waterproof jacket.
Still cold with occasional rain, though days begin to lengthen slightly toward month's end.
Mild spring conditions begin to emerge, with occasional sunny spells between showers.
Pleasant and increasingly warm, with blooming parks and a mix of sun and light rain.
One of the best months to visit, with warm temperatures and long, often sunny days.
Warm and lively with long daylight hours; occasional afternoon thunderstorms are possible.
The warmest month, generally sunny and dry; heat waves can occur, so stay hydrated.
Hot and sunny, though the city quiets as many locals leave on holiday.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with a good balance of sun and occasional rain.
Cooler and increasingly wet, with beautiful autumn foliage in parks and gardens.
Noticeably cold and damp with frequent rain; a warm coat and umbrella are essential.
Cold and festive, with Christmas markets and lights brightening the grey winter days.
